comments: Got ghosted after 7 rounds lol. When the 7th round was not a behavioural round I kind of know they are not serious in hiring. Apparently Goldman is well known in the industry to drag out interviews and then ghost, and maybe suddenly offer like after 4 months. I said I would apply again because it is interview practice in this market. But if you have a good employer maybe not worth the effort

Applied twice over my career. Once through referral and once reached out by their recruiter. Both times ghosted. First time ghosted immediately, second time after first interview. No response after trying to follow up.
Recruitment Expert Rajeev Rajan communicated everything and now the same guy isn't responding my phone calls or messages. Shitty company, Shitty people, shitty city. A complete Shit Show

Mathew from this so-called “India’s biggest UX agency” calls me up, says the CEO himself wants to meet me for an interview. Naturally, I thought this sounded promising - I mean, how often does a CEO get involved directly unless they’re serious?

We meet, talk projects, and everything feels good. Then he drops the “small task” on me. The condition? It should be a problem-focused case study with proper user research, not just pretty visuals. Fine, fair enough. I spend my weekend doing exactly that - 12–13 pages of research, process, strategy, and, on top of that, 5 fully designed mobile screens to tie it together. I submit it on time.

And then? Silence. Not even a “got it.” Days pass. I follow up, even cc the CEO. Finally, Mathew calls me back - not to acknowledge the work, but to ask why there are “only 5 screens.” Apparently, the CEO now wants more screens to “analyze my UI skills.”

Excuse me? Wasn’t the assignment supposed to be about research and problem-solving? I literally gave you the exact thing you asked for, with fully designed flows on top. But no, now it’s suddenly about cranking out more mockups because 5 polished screens apparently don’t count. So I asked him directly: If I do this extra work, can you at least confirm that I’ll be in the actual hiring pipeline? Guess what - dead silence. I asked again, cc’d the CEO this time. Still nothing.

At this point, it’s painfully obvious. This wasn’t hiring, this was fishing for free design work under the guise of an “assignment.” An agency with that kind of reputation bragging as “India’s biggest UX agency,” yet operating like a cheap design-sweatshop scam. Honestly, if that’s their process, they don’t deserve any designer’s respect.
I knew this company was sketchy as their online presence never existed (and for a Design company as they were marked).I t felt kind of a red flag yet i applied (Stupid me)

I received no communication from a recruiter at all. The first phase of interview was a take home test and the email said they would contact me after reviewing. I received no further communications, just the initial automated email asking me to complete the take home test.

The recruiter reached out through Indeed’s chat, said he’d gone through my profile, complimented my work, and made it sound like he was the decision-maker. He even said if I did well on the assignment, they’d hire me within a couple of weeks.

So I put in the time. I designed a full homepage for their cosmetic website, polished and professional, and sent it over. Then… nothing. No acknowledgment, no “got it,” not even a single follow-up message.

Classic ghosting. Hours of effort wasted. Honestly, it feels like a scam disguised as “recruitment.” Devastating.

This was the worst ghosting experience I’ve ever had. The recruiter gave me all the positive signals, even pushed urgency, and then made me do an entire app design - 4–5 screens, a detailed case study, plus user research. I spent over 6 hours on it and submitted everything on time.

It started with a call from HR, then multiple follow-ups from another HR, Konika. The role and package seemed like a fit, and they kept stressing urgency. After I submitted, silence. A week later, HR apologized for the delay, saying the team lead was on holiday. Then… nothing again.

I followed up multiple times with no response. Over a month later, the first HR randomly called again, asking if I was still open, the call ended awkwardly, almost like a wrong dial. A week later, she messaged me on WhatsApp apologizing for the delay because she’d been on her wedding holiday.

It’s now been 40+ days, and I’ve received no acknowledgment, no rejection, not even clarity on next steps. I’m confident my work wasn’t the issue - this is just a disorganized and unprofessional process.

If you’re applying to ShyftLabs, beware of the “urgency” they project. From what I’ve since heard in designer and developer circles, ghosting candidates is a pattern there. To whoever’s in charge of hiring: a simple automated acknowledgment, or basic communication about delays, would save candidates time and your reputation. Right now, it just feels shady and disrespectful.

I applied for a part-time UX/UI designer role, and they set up an interview. Sounds straightforward, right? Instead, I walk into a panel of three people, and the whole thing immediately goes off the rails.

One guy spends 30 minutes grilling me on React and JavaScript. This is a design role, but apparently, I had to explain the basics of hex codes in CSS, React modules, Redux, and all sorts of frontend trivia. Like, what exactly does this have to do with the JD you posted? If you wanted a frontend dev, you should’ve said so. And mind you, I actually have worked with React and frontend — but that’s not the point. You don’t bait designers with a part-time design role and then run a pop quiz like it’s a full-stack developer interview.

It didn’t end there. They also made me work on a website design project. I put in the effort, designed it, sent it across - and guess what? Total radio silence. Not even a “thanks, got it.” Two weeks later, after I followed up, the HR casually tells me I’m not in their pipeline anymore. That’s it. No explanation, no acknowledgment, nothing.

So yeah - bait, switch, and ghost. Classic time-wasting suckers.
Apply as an "AI Innovation Intern" to clone a fully working RAG support chatbot with deployment in 10 hours and as ask for how to improve their chatbot

Company is about-face by Halsey. They advertised as remote but said I’d have to fly into LA a couple of times a week to their office. Just a crazy experience all over, I had about 2 interviews with them.
Found out it's a cheap company that is hiring interns only.
They definitely just wanted free work and unfortunately I fell for it. Hours of my life I won’t get back. The CEO’s name is Phillip Chen and he is quite sleazy.

assignment_types: They were asking me to tell them a bit about myself, which I already did in my cover letter when I applied
ghosting_stages: No Response After Initial Inquiry (via call, email, or message)

comments: Pathetic company, had a final interview with fhe design director whoch went half an hour overtime, they all seemed to love me! But got ghosted unfortunately at the end
They sent 3 different design tasks and wanted that in 3 days - Design systems, Case study, Webpage

They invited me to an interview before I sent over the project that was branding for their new campaign and the interview was meant for the following Friday. Once I had done the task, the guy who I spoke to never responded. I asked if he had three days after and he said yes. After that, I heard nothing. I tried to call his number and nothing. Two weeks after, I even instagrammed the brand and they fobbed me off for over a week. Then the week after that he emailed saying he had hired someone else. So wasn’t even willing to give me the proposed interview. Sounds like they already hired and wanted free work ideas.

I already reached the manager's interview and based on our discussions, they view me positively even orienting me on the process that would happen after I get accepted. They asked me about my expected salary range and I told them I already answered it in their application form. After that meeting, I never heard from them. I inquired the HR who contacted me for the role but I received an auto-reply stating that she is on vacation.

assignment_types: 'Personality' test which was really a sales test on whether you are comfortable with selling products to your friends and family.
comments: They took my NRIC in full and ghosted me.

To shed more light on their process, already in the job application they required a VERY in depth amount of rework: 3-5 essay questions on top of the study. An applicant had to complete all of these in order to even apply. I was desperate for anything at the time, or else I’d never have considered it.

Naturally after sending it in, I received a “we’ve received your application and will be in touch!” form message and nothing else, and the listing stayed up on LinkedIn for at least a year afterward.
No, just wanna get the word out

Created a working mobile prototype for them, spent almost 20 hours on the assignment. They asked me to submit the prototype and Figma file on a particular date, and i did that, respecting the deadline. They told me that they would schedule a round soon to discuss my thought process, so i even prepared a presentation to walk them through everything, but that round was never scheduled. I followed up and got a rejection email instead, which was very frustrating.
The take home design assignment should have been a red flag.
I was ghosted after verbally being accepted for the role and being promised that a final offer letter was on its way

None really- had initial screening interview, plus 2 more interviews with the team, one of which included the design assignment review. Then had one more interview with the CFO. Didn’t hear anything for 2 weeks and followed up with the hiring manager, finally heard back a couple weeks after that saying that they were going through a reorg and I would hear back soon. Never heard back after that, followed up with HR who informed me that I would hear back from the hiring manager who never ended up getting in touch.

Ghosting after online interviews is to be expected, but this company insisted on an in-person interview in central London at the time and date of their choosing, meaning that I had to take leave from my job to attend.
Ghosted after OA even though all test cases passed.

First interview was technical interview and It was best interviewe ever and they told net step will be include HR but they never responded and sent any other email even though I sent two email to both HR and interviewer to follow up.
Seems like they have very high standards. Applied multiple times for different roles, all require take home assignments but absolutely zero feedback.

assignment_types: Creating a demo Shopify Store and later on, solving a few customer  issues
comments:
I wasn’t so much affected by the assignment, it was a basic one to test the candidate abilities. I am more frustrated because I was specifically told I will hear back from them early next week but I didn’t hear anything at all.
When I sent follow up emails, even they were not responded to.
All this wasted time and effort after 5 rounds of interviews for a Support role. Baffled!

This is the story of being double ghosted.

Praneetha, the HR, called me first - super urgent tone, made it sound like they needed me yesterday. Package looked good, I was hopeful. First round was with a “senior designer” who fired off what felt like ChatGPT-generated questions. I managed it, showed my portfolio, he seemed impressed.

Then came the assignment. Full app design + case study over a weekend. I delivered. A week later, Praneetha finally acknowledged it. Eventually, they set up a call with the “big UX manager.” I expected strategy talk, but nope - he hit me with textbook trivia: primary colors, Fitts’s law, contrast ratios. Felt like a school quiz, not a design interview. Still, I handled it.

Weeks passed. I asked if I was still in the process - Praneetha emailed saying they’d moved forward with someone else. Fine. But then, two weeks after rejecting me, she calls back to check if I’m still available. I said yes. And guess what? She vanished. Again.

What’s wrong with these people? Wasting candidates’ time with fake urgency, school-level questions, and zero respect for the effort.

ghosting_stages: No Response After Initial Inquiry (via call, email, or message)
comments:
I got an email saying my resume passed the screening process and they will contact me to schedule an interview in up to two weeks. Never happened. 

Also, I’d prefer not to apply there again, but there is very little demand for my skills where I live (Enschede) - hence, maybe I’ll apply again in the future if I see no other choice.

The director reached out directly because they messed up a hiring process with me not long ago and were sorry. They couldn't schedule my last interview for a Staff job and as time passed, they did an offer to someone who was already at the end of the process.

They asked me if I wanted to freelance, and scheduled a meeting with a manager to talk about the work. We agreed that we'd work together and was meant to come in person to sign a NDA and get into details. Wrote twice to the manager and even to the director to ask what's up, no answers.

On the day of the interview, it was roasting hot probably 32 Celsius. I thoughtbi interviewed well, they photocopied my right to work documents and ID which seemed promising? 

But agree my interview they then thanked me for even turning up, saying that other candidates had been no shows so would need to dicuss with hiring manager but would definitely be updating me. 

5 days went by. Last Friday I noticed the job advert reposted on their website with not 1 but 2 jobs on offer, a permanent job and a fixed term. I was absolutely furious to see what they had done behind my back with no regard to telling me I was unsuccessful.

I have raised a formal complaint and awaiting response from senior HR.

I think it is disgusting.

The company called me to hire me as an intern (well known company) even though I have a 2 year experience and I asked them if they can instead hire me as a junior product designer. They told me they only have positions open for an intern. I agreed because of the company's reputation and did a 10+ hour design assignment that was supposed to test my UX + UI skills. Post that I did a whiteboard assignment and was later asked to finalize the UI for the screens I went with during the assignment. I refused as it made no sense. They agreed and said I'll be interviewed by the founder as the last step. I later got a call telling me they've frozen the hiring.
I believe the male interviewer discriminated against me as a woman, even though I correctly solved the coding challenge and would not believe when I said I would enjoy this work.
Seems like they just wanted free work.
5 hours of interviews over a month period, then completely ghosted.
Piece of shit company

Ghosted after being strung along in follow up emails multiple times. I interviewed a couple weeks before the holidays. They responded the first couple times giving excuses about the holidays and noting a timeframe and then stopped responding.

assignment_types: Typing out example responses via MS Team Interview
comments:
I actually applied twice to these jokers.

The first time I was called by HR to arrange an interview I had already landed a job. 

When that job ended I applied again as saw they were recruiting. Sent email to HR woman who informed hiring manager.

Told HR this was my dream job 

Had teams interview...was told by manager and HR I would hear by tuesday/Wednesday but heard nothing 

Had to keep nagging them for an update. Eventually told I had been unsuccessful.

Hiring manager phoned to give me feedback...phone call was delayed abd feedback was you came across really well, so just carry on being you

Erm okay then.... pricks
One of the worst hiring experience as a job seeker. The HR promised to schedule the next call after 2 phone interviews and ghosted me completely.

The first interview was very normal, a bit of a technical screener but not too thorough as I was told that would come along in the next one or two interviews and the interviewer is kind and professional.

The second interview was so unprofessional it was bizarre. The interviewer mentioned my name was similar to a personal connection he no longer spoke to, was very cold in his questioning, admitted he did not read my resume and was not "good at reading resumes" but wanted me to explain my work and success so I did just that, only for him to say "I didn't hear xyz" so I'd explain how those were covered under umbrella terms like research and proceeded to go into higher detail. We had some strange interactions where his sound started cutting in and out and he commented "what's wrong with your face?" because I was squinting as I tried to hear him... just bizarre. His expressions always sided on negative or critical despite him saying he did very little to prepare.

I thanked him for the interview despite the negative vibes a day or two later but never heard back, about a week or two after hearing nothing, not even an acknowledgement of time spent I assumed nothing would come of the conversation. I did reach back out to the first interviewer but also nothing.

application_methods: They reached out to me on LinkedIn

comments: They actually reached out to me about 2 years later about another role, and I told them why I wouldn't be interested.

I did the screening well and she send me an invite for first technical interview right next day, most of the questions were expected like a textbook answer and although they were looking for a designer the 2 interviewers were asking heavily about reactjs and frontend questions and after that call its complete silence, they could have send a rejection or replay my post-interview follow up inquiry.
It was actually for an IT apprenticeship role. Didn't have that option so I picked junior software dev.

ghosting_stages: No Response After Initial Inquiry (via call, email, or message)

comments: They were hiring for a client and, the interview never reached the client as first screening and technical round were conducted by the Shell Infotech team themself

ghosting_stages: No Response After Initial Inquiry (via call, email, or message)
comments: Amarnath called a couple of times even in the weekend and giving this urgency as if he will be hiring in a week, but stops contact and when I called he said hiring people are on a vacay

ghosting_stages: No Response After Initial Inquiry (via call, email, or message)

comments: After the first interview, which I walked to the store to inquire about, the manager (heath, ohio) told me to return the following day at a set time. I did. Only to be told how she texted me, which was a lie, stag for me to retinturn again for paperwork giving me the exuse they were short staffed, unprepared, call offs, etc that she would contact me to let me know when. Never happened. So I go back to follow up a third time only to be told by the young teenage cashier to come back later, while the same manager couldnt bother to come out the kitchen and tell me directly. I didnt say anything and left. This was a week later. So basically 3 times I made myself known on my own will, no communication from anybody, kept receiving the same run around exuse. Finally just accepted it and gave up. I'm not going to continue to beg regardless how bad I need a job, after being told she would have the paperwork ready a week prior. I'm an older fella so I refuse to be treated that way. Utter nonsense and very unprofessional

Carolyn Komminsk, a recruiter at Onward Search, called me and also messaged on LI about a position I applied for. She thought I was qualified enough and wanted to ask me some questions and then do an initial video interview. She used an AI notetaker/screener during the first official interview. There was a lingering question about location of the job, whether it would be in my city or involve some travel or commuting. She promised to get back to me that week with an answer and to move forward in the interview process. After that interview, she never responded to email, voicemail, or LinkedIn. I never received a single message or call about the job again.

The people are generally nice, since i actually went there for an on-site interview. However, one thing that stuck to me during the whole interview process was them (the team Manager) constantly asking me if i really wanted the position, and to write them an email if i really do want it, even if i said it in person to them that i want this job. Sent them an Email 2 days after in person interview, no response at all, they actually told me in person to expect an answer after 2 weeks, but there was nothing. I emailed them again (personal email, not HR) exactly a  month after the interview, asking about their decision. Again i received no reply, but the next day i was sent an AI rejection Email instead.

ghosting_stages: No Response After Initial Inquiry (via call, email, or message)
comments: Reached out to me and then ghosted on the reply.
L&D Nurse manager told me to email after I applied to a position, I did just that and she continued to ignore me after 3-4 emails following up.

ghosting_stages: No Response After Initial Inquiry (via call, email, or message)
comments: I was actually ghosted twice by the same recruiter. Actually first time she called me for initial discussion and said I'll be sending you a calendar invite later by EOD but didn't receive it, next day when I called her back she didn't pick up the call. I again applied for a different job and again after initial HR discussion she said I'll be sending you a calendar invite, this time I even mailed her the next working day but didn't receive any response.
Interviewer verbally stated that she would email me, which made me even more upset since this promise was not honoured and they just ghosted me. This is totally unprofessional.

ghosting_stages: No Response After Initial Inquiry (via call, email, or message)
comments: Well, nothing personal against them. But i feel there is a real need for recruiters to be responsible enough to give a proper response to applicants, whether they are approved or rejected, so they don't hang in the middle, waiting for an opportunity not present.

I have been ghosted for almost a week, I had to email them, or personally message one of the employee there to get some follow up/result of the initial interview I had.
Looking back, there may have been some red flags during the interview I had with them.  
One of them being the interviewer emphasised that they are a small team and they have been working together for years and almost close friends, and one of the reasons I got the interview to begin with was that because I knew one of the employee and she gave me the referrals. 
I speculate that they posted the opening just to comply the law and the opening was aimed or made for the employee of the company.
